Key:
What's the matter? The screen with the "geme
turned black!"
It shut down?! Hey Reine, what's going on here?!
Hm...

I'm unsure of the cause, but it seems as though
the simulation is still running.

The simulation's still running, but we can't
monitor it from the outside? So, you're saying
we were the ones cut off?!
It would appear so.

Well, this is an unexpected disaster.
What's happening to Shido?

I don't know, but his consciousness hasn't
returned yet.
In other words, he's stuck in "My Little Shido 2".
So we can't talk to him?

Since the system is still running, I've been
trying to reach out to him in safe mode,
but there's been no reaction.

...Very well. It may come with its own obstacles,
but we'll need to force Shido to log out. I think
staying like this would be way more dangerous.
We can't.
Why not?! We can't just leave him in there.

I've been trying that already. No action on our
side is working.

Then how about force-quitting the simulator?
If the device itself is powered off...

That would be difficult, too. Any commands from
the outside seem to be completely non-functional.

What the hell?! So there's a bug in the
programming? No, but even if it were
that, it's still weird!

Yeah, the conditions seem odd for just an ordinary
bug. We're using the Realizer, so I can't think
of ways this could happen in the first place.

Do you think someone's intervening from
the outside? Is that possible?!

Yes. Given the presence of that mysterious NPC,
I'm sensing that someone has tampered with it.
Are you suggesting the Fraxinus has been hacked?!

Right... Though it would be immensely difficult to
do so... No, we can pretty much say it's
impossible.

The Fraxinus's security can't be hacked, even with
all the power of DEM's digital brain department
combined.

Regardless, we need to figure out the cause
of this first in order to get Shido back.

If the commands to log out of the simulation
aren't working, then we'll have to physically
separate him from the device...
No, that's too dangerous...

If we force-quit, there's a strong possibility
that it'll injure his brain.
What... Rgh...

God, Shido! Why do you always have to get
into trouble?!

What's going on, Kotori? Reine? What happened to
Shido? He seems to be sleeping... Can we not wake
him?
We can't do that, Tohka-chan. Judging from what I\njust heard, if we force Shido-kun off, it seems\nlike it won't end well for him.
Exactly...
N-No... Shido-san...

Then, Shido is going to remain like this?! I-Is
there a possibility... that he'll never wake
up...?
N-No... That can't be. I don't want that!
Shido... Yuzuru, Shido will be okay, right...?
Anxious... Yuzuru feels the same way, Kaguya.
Darling...

This isn't good. It's starting to drastically
affect the Spirits' states.

You're right... I mean it's all happening right
before their eyes. I don't blame them.

But if they rampage while Shido's like this, we
won't have any countermeasure. We need to figure
something out for Shido before things get bad.

Kotori, you don't need to be so tough. You're
worried about your brother too, right?

I-It's not like that! I'm saying this
as the Commander!

Just calm down, Kotori. I'm going to focus on
ascertaining the cause. You handle the Spirits.
Got it.

If we force Shido awake, we don't know what'll
happen to his mental state. But for now,
he's fine.
O-Oh, so long as he's safe.
Darling, I'm so worried～

Shido... I can't believe he will linger in the
void of sleep...
This...
Did you figure something out, Reine?!

I can't say I've figured it out just yet. But I
was able to verify something irregular
inside the Fraxinus's main computer.
So was it that cyber-attack thingy?

No... As I said earlier, it's pretty much impossible
to hack into the Fraxinus's main computer.
For a human, that is.
Question. What do you mean by that?
So you're saying if you're not human,\nyou can do it? Is that it?
Hm? What do you mean by that, Yoshinon?

If it's not a human, isn't it obvious? It must be
the doing of an unidentified Spirit...

A S-Spirit...? Is there a very powerful Spirit-san
inside the... machine...?

Just like my Gabriel, there are Angels with special
abilities... So you're saying there are Spirits
with the ability to do something like this, right?

Yeah, your assumptions are correct. However, maybe
it's premature at this point to call it a Spirit.
What do you mean?

This Spirit-like existence doesn't exist in the
real world. It's as if the program itself contains
the power of a Spirit.
So this thing is only active via data?!
Could it be—
No, wait a minute!
What's the matter, Kotori?
Is it possible... that it could be an AI Spirit?

Yes, I was thinking that could be a possibility. I
wouldn't be surprised if an organization like DEM
created it to use the Spirits' powers for evil.

Yeah. So they accessed data that contained Spirit
powers... And it would make sense that they were
able to bypass the Fraxinus's security.

The other alternative is that this was done by
someone who has access to the main computer...
but I don't think that's the case.

Hmph. Of course. Anyways, we're getting on the
right track now.

This means war. It's a date between that thing and
us...

Yes. If there has been interference from the
outside, the girl that Shin met earlier seems
the most suspicious.

Yeah. She seemed a bit inhuman, so I'd hazard a
guess that she's our girl. Ugh... We totally
fell for it...

Let's get her and put her in a cell where she can
never sweep our mines ever again.
...That sounds like a fun space.

Right? It'll be specially designed with a 90%
increase in land mines. Anyways...

Right. I'm sure we can do something with the
information we have. Let's look for ways we can
save Shin.
I'll leave you to it.

Anyways, to be cracked like this now, of all
times... Can it be... their aim all along was
to strike precisely during testing...?
